prompt:
Access Point
RF.3.3.L

Student will match letter sounds with their letter correspondences or words with corresponding visuals.

Requirements
Restrictions
  • Every performance task must have at least five unique items/questions.
  • Students may match five:
    • letter sounds with their letter correspondences
    • words to corresponding visuals
    • or a combination of both
  • In a multiple-choice item, a minimum of three answer choices must be provided.
None

Teacher Directions
Teacher Directions: (Read the text in bold to the student.)
This is a hat, /h/ hat. (Point to the hat.) This is a van, /v/ van. (Point to the van.)Which letter makes the sound of /v/ in the word van? (Read the answer choices to the student.)

B; v

prompt:
Access Point
RF.3.3.L.

Student will match letter sounds with their letter correspondences or words with corresponding visuals.

Requirements
Restrictions
  • Every performance task must have at least five unique items/questions.
  • Students may match five:
    • letter sounds with their letter correspondences
    • words to corresponding visuals
    • or a combination of both
  • In a multiple-choice item, a minimum of three answer choices must be provided.
None

Teacher Directions
Teacher Directions: (Read the text in bold to the student.)
Here are three pictures. (Point to the pictures.) This is a cat. (Point to the cat picture, repeat the initial /c/ sound, and then say the word, “cat”.) This is a dog. (Point to the dog picture, repeat the initial /d/ sound, and then say the word, “dog”.) This is a man. (Point to the man picture, repeat the initial /m/ sound, and then say the word, “man”.) Which letter makes the sound of /m/ in the word man? (Point to the answer choices.)

C; M

  • Students may match five:
    • letter sounds with their letter correspondences
    • words to corresponding visuals
    • or a combination of both
  • In a multiple-choice item, a minimum of three answer choices must be provided.
None
teacherDirections:
Teacher Directions
Teacher Directions: (Read the text in bold to the student.)
Here are three pictures. (Point to the pictures.) This is a cat. (Point to the cat picture, repeat the initial /c/ sound, and then say the word, “cat”.) This is a dog. (Point to the dog picture, repeat the initial /d/ sound, and then say the word, “dog”.) This is a man. (Point to the man picture, repeat the initial /m/ sound, and then say the word, “man”.) Which letter makes the sound of /m/ in the word man? (Point to the answer choices.)
prompts: Which letter makes the sound of /m/ in the word <u>man</u>?
